title: Ticket #6958: Param CHIRP_DELAYED_UPDATE_PREFIX is broken
description:
Contrary to its name and vague documentation, the config param CHIRP_DELAYED_UPDATE_PREFIX is a list of the full names of attributes that can be set via Chirp's set_job_attr_delayed command. A single asterisk, which can appear anywhere in each entry, can be used for wildcard matching. The default value was originally Chirp*.

In 8.6.10, the shadow was changed to treat the items in CHIRP_DELAYED_UPDATE_PREFIX as prefixes of attribute names with no wildcard option, and the default value was changed to Chirp (#6557). The code in the starter wasn't changed. Thus, Chirp is now the only attribute that can be set in the default configuration. To be useable, CHIRP_DELAYED_UPDATE_PREFIX must be set differently for the shadow and starter. The values for the starter need a trailing asterisk and the values for the shadow can't have one.
remarks:
2019-Apr-01 15:23:38 by jfrey:
Code Review

The code makes CHIRP_DELAYED_UPDATE_PREFIX into a list of attribute name prefixes.

This will break any configuration of CHIRP_DELAYED_UPDATE_PREFIX from 8.6 or before, where a trailing asterisk was required. Do we want to handle those configurations, or require that admins change their config files?

2019-Apr-09 15:55:11 by jfrey:
Code Review

  • The new changes look good.

  • The standard plural of prefix appears to be prefixes, not prefices.

2019-Apr-09 16:13:15 by tlmiller:
  • The standard plural of =prefix= appears to be =prefixes=, not =prefices=.

Huh! So it is. I must be using K&R English, rather than English (17)89.
